channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: James Talarico says the biggest ‘welfare queens’ in America are ‘the giant corporations that don’t pay a penny in income taxes’
item.description: The 2026 Senate hopeful says major corporations cost taxpayers far more than social safety net programs.

item.title: Natasha Lyonne says AI has an ethics problem because right now it’s ‘super kosher copacetic to rob freely under the auspices of acceleration’
item.description: Lyonne’s production company developed a tool for generating big screen-ready AI content.

item.title: Gen Z is open minded about blue-collar work and the Fords of the economy need them — but both sides are missing each other
item.description: Clinton Crawford, an automotive technician, said college was pushed on his kids. “That’s good, if that’s for you, but I don’t think it’s for everyone....

item.title: Tesla’s chief designer accidentally smashed a $61K Cybertruck’s ‘armor glass’ window with a metal ball. Now he says it was a ‘great marketing moment’
item.description: CEO Elon Musk claimed more than 200,000 orders for the vehicle following its botched reveal in 2019.

item.title: ‘They’ll lose their humanity’: Dartmouth professor says he’s surprised just how scared his Gen Z students are of AI
item.description: A lot of Scott Anthony's students are excited to use AI, he told Fortune, but a meaningful portion are "scared full stop." They have "hesitation and f...

item.title: As stock rally broadens, it’s tough for the S&P 500 to keep rising without tech
These 10 tech stocks are rarely this cheap. Are they deals, or value traps?
After Trump’s move to reclassify cannabis, here’s what Wall Street is thinking
The labor market has cooled off—here's the jobs outlook for 2026
These moves can cut your taxes and make your refund even bigger than Trump says
